column4: My computer just shut down, randomly. Any reason why it might do that? When I turn it back on and boot, it gives me a few lines about WARNING something something (I can't copy the text).
you can try looking at the logs in /var/log/syslog or /var/log/kernlog to see what they say...
syslog shows me the errors: http://pastebin.ca/953457
so any idea what those mean or how I can fix them?
the modprobe ones are where it's trying to load alsa (sound drivers) into the kernel, it doesn't like something on line 40 of /etc/modprobe.d/alsa-base
it says something about line 41, too
yup, something on those two lines
ok, at least I know where to start now
I will ask my pet linux nerd. :)
always good to have one around :)
I don't have permissions to safe alsa-base
I wanted to just erase those two lines and see what happens
if you want to edit it, you will need to have root privileges...what editor are you using?
ok, open a terminal, and type gksudo gedit /etc/modprobe.d/alsa-base             and then you'll be able to save it
Sweet, I took out line 40 and 41 that it didn't like.  Maybe it will help.
